title: David Beckham has been snapped up by China to help them win the World Cup

David Beckham has been snapped up by the Chinese government - to help the country win the World Cup . 
The former England skipper answered a plea from President Xi Jingping, who has vowed to win football’s biggest prize. 
Beckham and the Chinese leader became friends in 2012 after meeting at a Los Angeles Lakers basketball game. 
Football-mad President Xi is hoping the ex-Manchester United star can inspire the next generation of Chinese footballers. 
Beckham will appear daily on Chinese state television introducing a series of coaching videos for youngsters. Read More David Beckham, Brooklyn Beckham and Ed Sheeran walk out of London pub after taunts from football hooligans Xi Jinping needs Beckham's help (Photo: Reuters) 
He filmed his segment in the city of Guangzhou last year and the show will be aired 365 days-a-year from next month. 
It will be shown on CETV - which is broadcast in 400,000 schools across China with an astonishing audience of 971 million people. 
In his introduction, Beckham says: “Football is a fantastic sport which requires strength, speed, brains and teamwork. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now David Beckham gets involved in pancake day action Share this video Watch Next 
“I started to learn football when I was very young. It really is the best time to start. My advice to you is to take your time, build a solid foundation with basic skills. 
“If you practice every day you will get better. Best wishes to China’s future football stars.” 
The Adidas-sponsored TV series is the brainchild of Tom Byer - an American regarded as a coaching guru in the Far East. David and Cruz Beckham (Photo: Instagram) 
He was poached from rivals Japan by China’s Ministry of Education to revolutionise football in the country. 
Mr Byer told the Mirror: “Only eight countries have won the World Cup. That’s because football is in their culture. 
“What the videos and other initiatives will hopefully do is educate families and children. We want them to start from the moment they can walk, teaching them to manipulate a football. 
“If you wait until children are six or seven and then give them a ball, it’s too late. China has a culture that school is for studying and that’s all that matters. David Beckham with his sons and daughter Harper (Photo: Rex) 
“To be successful in football, parents need to allow their children to put the time in at school. We need educate families that children involved in physical activity do better academically. 
“It is great that David has come onboard as he’s a huge name in China and will help inspire the kids.” 
President Xi is a lifelong Manchester United fan and met Gary Neville during an official tour to the UK in 2015. 
The Chinese leader has an array of signed football shirts from stars including Lionel Messi and Zlatan Ibrahimovich. The Chinese president is a fan of David Beckham (Photo: PA) 
He has demanded 50,000 schools in China have specialist football coaching and has made the sport a compulsory part of the curriculum. 
President Xi also announced plans to create 60,000 new football fields across the country by 2020. 
He wants to create a footballing culture in China - and eventually see his country win the World Cup. 
Most Chinese believe football was invented in the country - yet it is currently 86th in the Fifa world rankings. 
It has only made it to one World Cup - exiting the 2002 tournament in humiliation without scoring a goal. 
President Xi said this is unacceptable for a country with a population of 1.4 billion and has demanded change. Like us on Facebook
